review_body: Located a block away from Central Park this hotels location allowed us to enjoy to different side of NYC From arrival to departure the staff could not have been more welcoming and no request was too much troubleHaving not stayed on the Upper East Side before, it gave a chance to see and experience a totally different area of NYCOur room was spacious and had a very homely feel to itThe hotel is very upbeat in the bar, then provides a very relaxed feel in the restaurantDecor throughout is very interesting with murals adorning many of the walls in both rooms and other areasBeds are super comfy and the rooms very quiet to outside noise, the presentation of the room is like no other hotel i have ever stayed in, truly first classLooking forward to a return stay

After having a wonderful stay at Rosewood Georgia Vancouver, we decided to give their sister property a shot. This is a very historic hotel with the perfection location. Very good views as well, at least for my room. Everything was just so perfect there. Rosewood never disappoints

The Carlyle is finishing and extensive room update. Good news the room decor I’d wonderful! Our room had a partial view across 76th street of Central Park, nice except the room was small even though it was a “deluxe king”. Also changed is there is no longer their fabulous breakfast buffet. The Bemelman bar is still iconic New York.
user_name:
Don P
Indianapolis, Indiana, United States

review_body: This is easily the best hotel in New York. It is easily the best hotel I have ever stayed in and I can stay beats out several #1 US and World ranked hotels that I have stayed in over the years. Without question it is worth every penny.

This was our first stay here and we loved it. The room was the most beautiful one we have ever stayed in in the US. Gorgeous marble bath, chocolate and milky white room walls, high end furniture pieces, Frette robes and linens, Nespresso machine, Kiehl’s products, all just gorgeous and made us feel so refreshed. Nice sunny fitness center. Dog friendly amenities were adorable. Bemelmans bar did not disappoint. The service throughout the stay was perfect. We will 100 percent return. A famous celebrity couple was checking in while I was lounging in the lobby. Also, this property was in a perfect location for Madison Avenue shopping. The new Ralph’s Coffee at the RL store is two blocks away and really cute.

Absolutely lovely stay- had high expectations and was not disappointed. The little details are what makes it special- truffles at the elevator, wonderful staff, mini muffins at morning coffee...Only wished our pillowcases had been monogrammed- will need to inquire next time to see if they can make that happen

I stayed at the Carlyle for a quick weekend trip in the city. Everything was perfect from the beautiful rooms, the kind staff, and the CHARM of the hotel. The luxury experience was one of a kind, and I can't wait to come back!

My wife and I visited your hotel after a 15 year hiatus. It did not disappoint in any way. The new rooms are perfect as was all of your staff we interacted with. We look forward to our next stay with you.

For many years it was the St. Regis, then in more recent years the Mark. I've not been happy with the Mark so I tried the Carlyle. My hesitation in staying in the past was because the rooms had gotten a little long in the tooth. All that has changed. They are updated and FANTASTIC.This level of service hardly exists in any hotel any longer.

We had the most wonderful time and all because of the Carlyle. It was a fairytale weekend and lived up to my big expectations. Every. Single. Detail. All perfect! Cannot wait to book our next stay! xo Erica

Have been to NY several times the last couple of years, but it was the first time staying here. Will not be the last.Restaurant, bars, room, staff and service was ofcourse top notch. WOnderfull experience. Location wise it is ideal when looking for a calmer NY experience.

Tony McHale is without question the single greatest hospitality executive I have ever encountered. His attention to detail – and demand for excellence- was evident in every aspect of our stay (as it always is). The Carlyle has become a second home to my wife and me and there is simply no other hotel like it. We cannot wait for our next visit.

We have stayed at The Carlyle on several occasions and it never disappoints...Beautiful lobby and rooms...every time one turns around there is someone offering to help you...comfortable beds, also one can step right out the door and pop into Zitomers Pharmacy for all sorts of needed items, both beauty and clothing.

Great location , room brand new remodel , fantastic bar , great services ,attention staff, near great very expensive store just what I like , exciting like Paris ,London ...............etc , Gucci Chanel ,zanotti

Our second visit, stayed five nights. All services are good, comfortable updated bedroom, charming lift attendants - staff treat you as a real person that they take genuine interest in. Bemelmans Bar is a lovely place, and the breakfast is well worth lingering over.

What an amazing hotel! We’ve been looking forward to our stay at the Carlyle for a very long time. This gem of a property in the Upper East Side is truly remarkable. If you’ve watched Always at the Carlyle or read any of the reviews you have an idea of just how special this place is. I believe it has ~190 rooms, yet it feels utterly like a boutique property. The hotel was completely sold out yet it never felt too crowded at any time. Yes the bar was full but the energy was palpable. The whole property is quaint, yet energetic. We were booked in a Superior room with a King bed. It was one of the recently renovated rooms and we absolutely loved everything about it. The bed was extremely comfortable. It had a huge TV which you could maneuver to the position you would like. The bathroom, albeit a little small, was perfectly adequate for us with some amazing bath products. However the real reason we fell in love iwth this place and why we will definitely come back to The Carlyle is the staff. Wow! We had never stayed here. We have never met any of these people. Yet after only two nights we were so very sad to leave. From the jovial doorman, to the front desk staff, to housekeeping, to the delightful elevator gentlemen, we felt like we were at home during our entire stay. Let us not forget the AMAZING concierge! They assisted us in the months before we arrived with dining reservations and holiday activities as well as several times during our stay - everyone was such a delight to work with. I’m not sure it would be appropriate to say this is a hidden gem but maybe in a city the size of New York it still is. The location was simply perfect. Just far enough away from the craziness of mid-town in the Upper East side. What’s not to love about the Upper East side besides a $28 grilled cheese? Its truly an Oasis. Boutique shopping and amazing restaurants all around. Just 2 minutes and you’re in Central Park; within five minutes you’re inside The Met. You feel incredibly safe everywhere you go. We loved taking the long walk through the park down to Wollman ice-skating rink and into Mid-town. We cant give anything but praise to this amazing property. Christmas is a truly magical time of year in New York City. Staying at the Carlyle made it even more so. We can’t wait to visit them again!

Excellent Hotel but unable to get into the bar or the café as they were always rammed full. Was quoted $125 each to get into the café to listen to some music. So if your after a relaxing ambience to eat or talk with your loved ones or friends it's not the place to go.

Professionalism and the highest quality are the norm at the Carlyle.The location can't be beat, but the staff makes this hotel worth the cost of staying there. Ambiance, amenities, food and beverage selections,quality and effecient service make being at the Carlyle a real pleasure.

The room is lovely. The wait staff top notch! But we were 4 women jammed around around table meant for 2. There was barely room to pick up the spoon to stir the sugar in the tea! The petit four and the tea sandwiches arrived on a tiered serving piece, theteapots put onto the table - so jammed and unappealing! It is a pity as the price was not inexpensive, but the whole effect was charmless and rather chaotic. And the tables were so close together - neighboring conversations were easily overheard and we had to talk rather uncharacteristically loud in order to hear each other. I have had the privilege of enjoying high tea around the world and this was by far the worst. The Carlyle could learn a tea lesson from The Taj in Mumbai and Fortnum & Mason in London. I won't be back.

Everytime i requested simple things for my suite; I received no response unless I re reported twice or thruce. I fell in the room through their negligence I reported it in writing. On the last day after I checked out I demanded to see the manager.

Just spent a long weekend with my daughter and we had an amazing stay at the Carlyle. The staff there is incredible and really strives to make sure every one of their guests feels like a VIP. The Carlyle is also home to one of the best lounges in Manhattan.

We’ve been coming to New York for years and rarely stay in the same hotel - it’s not that we’re fussy but we’ve never found one that ticks all the boxes. I’m pleased to say we finally have From the moment we walked in the level of service was amazing and it didn’t stop until we left. The refurbished room was superb - lighting,toiletries, tv, mini bar etc etc were too notch - the bar and restaurant were brilliant and the staff so friendly we never wanted to leave!We are so coming back soon!

The Carlyle is the height of style, sophistication and Luxury. Every detail is attended to and each and every employee is 110% committed to your comfort and making sure that every need is met with a smile and warmth!

The old-style Carlyle has been one of my favorites since I first visited the hotel over 20 years ago. It’s truly an institution on Upper-East side. We love the bar with live jazz music, the breakfast, the service, the serviced elevators, the best concierges anywhere (thx to Jeff and Stephanie), the wonderful spa and the newly renovated rooms that really are outstanding. We will be back!

My wife and I stayed at the Carlyle for five nights three weeks ago for our fifth wedding anniversary! Entire experience was fantastic. We have stayed at other Rosewood properties and this one did not disappoint!We loved all the special Carlyle touches. The elevator attendants were so old school.We especially wanted to thank Mustafa Sukkar, night manager for the smooth arrival and getting us right into a table to Bemelmans Bar on check in night just in time for us to order food off the menu (Flight was delayed by two hours so we arrived to the hotel a bit later than planned). The piano bar band was even notified it was our anniversary and recognized us with song that very first night.Great breakfast in the hotel restaurant, had the feel of a private club. Since we had booked with AMEX platinum fine hotels and resorts we got a lovely room upgrade and the breakfast was complimentary.On our final night of our stay we were lucky enough to get a table for two to catch Woody Allen’s Jazz band playing their regular Monday night gig at the very intimate Cafe Carlyle. My wife had a champagne and I got to try the special Carlyle Manhattan. The room we were in was the newly renovated section and was well appointed complete with shower and bath and even a walk in closet. Regrettably the higher floors were under construction (which will be great for a future stay)Even with the beyond impeccable accommodations and service what makes the Carlyle shine is a fantastic location. The place has a great neighborhood feel and is “around the corner” just blocks away from the Frick, The Met and the Guggenheim. Central Park is just “down the street” a block away. Given that we stayed early fall with great morning weather, I was able to grab a morning run in Central Park two mornings of our stay so I never got to see the gym facilities (which would probably get more use from winter travelers). Either way when we went out one night, to the circus that is Times Square, to catch the musical Hamilton we really appreciated the contrast of the serenity of “our neighborhood” at the Carlyle. Great meals were also had “in the neighborhood” at Flora Bar (literally down the street), Jo Jo, and Bar Italia a little further down Madison Avenue.My wife and I will definitely return. Thank you so much to all the Carlyle staff.

I was very impressed with the first Carlyle Stay after the warm welcome of the staff. I am very happy with the homely atmosphere.I would like to stay again.It is very convenient to be within walking distance such as MET.

The Carlisle is a beautiful hotel with staff that is unfailingly polite and accomodating. Unfortunately, we have a number of problems and will not be back.The biggest issue was that the bed was not comfortable. The slightest movement, even by an arm, would move the bed and disturb a partner. Further, the bottom sheet was scratchy and uncomfortable and the pillow covers were slick so that they moved from where we placed them, either under our head or between knees.The second issue was that my wife had a hair (not hers) in her yogurt at breakfast. The waiter saw the hair and mentioned it, but did not apologize. If the manager was told, he also did not mention it or apologize.A smaller issue is the lack of outlets in the room. Further, the one I found and plugged my phone into did not work, so my cell phone's battery was dead in the morning.Also, the wallpaper had peeled and a part of it was removed in the "recently refurbished room.The hotel is lovely and the staff unfailing polite and accommodating. It is a shame the standards have fallen to the extent that they have. We will not be back.

Stayed here whilst visiting family in NYC. The Carlyle is certainly deserving of its wonderful reviews and 5* rating.The rooms were of a very high standard (although my suite did have a tiny bathroom!) and kept wonderfully clean and tidy throughout the stay. I only ate at the hotel for breakfast but it was of a very high quality with great staff - in room dining was also brilliant and not overly expensive given the quality. Could not recommend the spa enough - all the staff are very well qualified and I had a fantastic experience at both the spa and the hair salon.Only issue is that apparently the whole of the 9th floor was having problems with their heating/cooling system (same in the room occupied by the rest of my party)... rooms were pretty chilly and the front desk attempted to solve this remotely but sadly unsuccessfully. Certainly nothing to ruin the stay and I would highly recommend this hotel for both its comfort and service as well as prime uptown location!

My brief stay was outstanding! From the moment I arrived, staff were there to help with almost anything I needed (only Exception: Dish network meant there was no Fox channel to watch the game, but no big deal). The rooms were recently renovated, very clean, and very nice. There are staff to help you at every door, every room, every lobby, every elevator, and every curb. The staff sincerely aim to take care of every guest. I want to recognize Naz, GoGo, and Luis, all of whom were extremely helpful during my stay. I really enjoyed my stay, and I hope to return.

Whenever I need to visit NYC (which is often), I always check the Carlyle first for availability. It has become my home away from home for several reasons. The midtown location is ideal for me, within walking distance of the very best shops and cultural attractions. Having Bemelman's Bar and the Cafe Carlyle in the same building is a plus. This hotel is the epitome of Old New York... with their newly remodeled rooms, is both fresh, beautiful and iconic. The food in the restaurant is consistently delicious... So much so that I happily hosted my daughter's baby shower in the private dining room. They tailored everything to my requests, and they did not disappoint! Sometimes I travel with my husband, but sometimes I travel alone... Unlike some NYC hotels, I am always perfectly comfortable and at ease, even if I am traveling solo. I feel that this is owing to the exceptional staff who are both friendly, helpful and very professional. A special shout-out to Julie at the front desk, who goes above and beyond being accommodating to one's needs in order to ensure that your stay is both comfortable and pleasant.

Although we only stayed one night, it was an amazing visit!. My husband and I had just flew in from Milan after a 10 day trip celebrating my 65th birthday. We live in Connecticut but didn't want to go home right away so we decided to "decompress" for the night before heading home at one of our favorite places to be......The Carlyle. We usually go there for dinner and have only stayed there twice before but will definitely do a lot more "weekend get aways" there. Everyone treated me so special and made my birthday experience the best ever!. The gentleman who brought up our bags even sang happy birthday to me!!! We stayed in the remodeled junior suite on the 14th floor! I would live there if It had a kitchen! From the people at the reception desk to the gentlemen on the elevator to the bartender and so on......everyone we came in contact with made us feel at home. We actually rated the hotels and experience we had for the past 10 days....Le Bristol in Paris to Villa D'Este in Lake Como.......The Carlyle was our favorite by far. Thank you all who made our transition to reality a memorable experience.

I had heard of The Carlyle from friends and colleagues, and also from the media, but never really prepared myself for the experience. It felt like walking onto a Hollywood set, i half expected Garbo or Hayworth to walk past me any minute.Expensive, yes, but very much worth it. Attention to detail from the moment you step out of the car to the moment you step back out to leave.Friendly, polite, courteous, and helpful. Everything you could ask for, and more.Thank you for making my birthday stay so special!!!

Not your typical NYC hotel. Warm, helpful and pleasant staff. We typically stay in Chelsea or Soho but warmed up quickly to the area. Looking forward to going back. We have found our next go to hotel.

I knew of The Carlyle's storied history, but had never stayed there because I perceived it as an "older" hotel. I was so wrong! I used an American Express Platinum card promotion to book my first, 3-night stay at the Carlyle due to its location near my destination. The lobby is still a glorious marble with the traditional fixtures, and the Café and Bar have retained all of their traditional décor and somewhat formal, 5-star service. However, my newly renovated room (1107) was light, bright, and the fixtures and decor were modern and perfectly laid out. Everything was so elegant and well-thought-out, I could easily have stayed for a week or more. We also found the service was extraordinary - friendly and warm but still suited to the hotel's elegance and history. The Front Desk, old-world elevator operators, housekeeping staff, and restaurant staff were all fantastic - genuinely interested in us as well as in upholding the Carlyle's service. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, but the menu included traditional, healthy, AND fast alternatives that suited all lifestyles. My Amex promotion included a break on spa services, which were highly professional (my eyebrows have never looked so good :-) Lastly, the hotel's location right in the heart of the Madison Ave shopping district (and acccessible to the 77th Street subway station) can't be beat - it's both super-quiet and super-accessible. You can be comfortable here whether you're on a business trip or casual vacation - I will definitely be back.

It has been several years since I stayed at this hotel and I was anxious to see if it still provided the high-end ambiance and service to match the costs. Not too worry. Bemelmans Bar still produces one of the finest martinis in Manhattan and their appetizers and meals are top rate. Most importantly, the staff at this remarkable hotel make the stay a memorable family-friendly event. We stayed 4 nights and built our trip around a visit to the Met which is within walking distance or a very short cab ride. We had a dining area in our apartment and so took advantage of room service for dinner on 2 nights. Super service and very good food at a reasonable (for New York) price. Try the oysters on the half shell - they are fresh and perfect for a starter. My family loves this place and I'm very pleased to recommend it.

Much enjoyed my stay here as ALWAYS. Always feels like coming home. Everything perfect with the Carlyle’s usual simple elegance, manners and style. Could not ask for more! Thanks fir everything. Please never change.

The Carlyle treated us well during our stay— all the staff were gracious and made our wedding anniversary special. They allowed us to check in early, upgraded our suite, and charmingly put a picture from our wedding in a picture frame to welcome us when we arrived (then let us keep the framed picture as a memento.) Not only that, they decorated the room with balloons and festive anniversary decor, and then redecorated with flowers and signs when we got back after dinner. The guest relations manager, Kyna Chang, also noticed a card I wrote on the desk promising my brother-in-law soap from The Carlyle (he loves that type of thing). Kyna wrote me asking if I would like an extra supply of soaps to take home. The Carlyle family is real. It has an old world charm and elegance second to none. My wife and I can not recommend The Carlyle highly enough. They made us feel part of the furniture. We will definitely be returning soon. With warm regards, Deaglan

We stayed at the Carlyle for four nights for my son’s 21st birthday. Everything was perfect from the moment we checked in until we left. The front desk and guest relations even arranged to decorate my son’s room and left cake and champagne. They called to make sure everything went well and my son was surprised. We’ve stayed at this hotel multiple times and it’s our favorite when visiting New York. Looking forward to coming back soon!

Came in to town at 1:50 pm with a promise of early check in at noon. Waited 40 minutes until the room was ready. Nicely renovated room with ample space. However, after coming in from a late dinner, we noticed the air conditioning was not working (on the hottest weekend of the summer). They offered to move our room after cleaning another room on the same floor but the engineer who checked out the a/c said they were having a lot of problems on that floor. And the hallways were hot and humid. We changed hotels a block away at 12:30 am. At least they didn’t charge us.
user_name:
jfkk2014
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Many film stars and internationally known people stop at the Carlyle. If you frequent the hotel you will find that you have pillow cases embroided with you names, making your stay all the more congenial. Good restaurant and bar, and superb in house service. The concierage can work magic to get you into a variety of theater productions and/or restaurants of every kind. If you have pleanty of bucks, this is the place to stay in NYC....and that's true.

Excellent hotel in a quiet location. It is close to subway at about 1 1/2 blocks and 1 block from a beautiful area of Central Park. Any change issue or request we made was fulfilled promptly and pleasantly. Attention was paid to the smallest detail. The other guests were also pleasant, friendly and interesting. I was there for about a week. I had plenty of time to see the good and the bad but there is nothing bad I can report. They have really set the bar high for friendly service at an upscale facility without being stuffy or uncomfortable. I think no matter where you are the staff always makes or breaks a place and the staff was incredible, from the doormen, security and room staff to the front desk.

Spent four nights at the Carlyle in July with my daughter. We loved our room on the 11th floor, and found the staff so friendly and helpful, as usual. I have probably stayed there more than 20 times, and can't imaging staying anywhere else. Bemelmans Bar just puts the icing on the cake. They could not have made our stay any better!
user_name:
jmselig
Los Osos, California, United States

review_body: We booked a three night stay at The Carlyle to celebrate a special occasion and the whole experience was superb. The hotel embodies wonderful Upper East Side New York glamour, just as we’d envisaged. A discreet entrance just off Madison Avenue leads to the small, elegant lobby decorated in Art Deco monochrome with splashes of golden velvet.While the hotel is exclusive we found the service friendly and attentive throughout. And everyone seems to be greeted with “nice to see you” whether it’s your first or hundredth visit. The Carlyle is being subtly refurbished in parts but cleverly all the classic features that make it special are still there including the famous Bemelmans Bar and the elevator attendants.Our room was one of the recently refurbished ones and successfully blended classic with contemporary. There were some lovely touches such as Central Park murals and quirky rabbit objects reminiscent of the Bemelmans bar downstairs. The room wasn’t huge and the bathroom a bit tight but that’s usual for New York and the beautiful décor made up for it. We enjoyed fabulous breakfasts every morning in the chic Carlyle Restaurant. And dinner there was the icing on the cake of our stay. We were given the type of table we’d requested beforehand (a corner banquette) and the classic menu and slick service matched the stylish setting perfectly.For exploring the Upper East Side the hotel’s location was also superb. We had the Met museums and Central Park right on our doorstep and of course the shops of Madison Ave. There are newer, trendier hotels in more fashionable parts of New York but for sheer class this is hard to beat.

We stayed at the Carlyle over the 4th of July week to celebrate my Birthday and The 4th of July.. Had a recently renovated suite that was huge. Our adult children joined us with spouses (THEY had their own rooms) and they were able to come and have pre-dinner gatherings with no trouble fitting them all in. Great location and felt very safe in the area when walking. Will definitely choose this hotel again.

I brought eight friends to rent four rooms at The Carlyle to celebrate a very special birthday. The Hotel anticipated every need and went out of their way to make this three day experience truly magical. Stephanie the Concierge and Charles the Captain truly went above and beyond. I cannot thank the hotel enough for everything they did for me and my friends! A life long fan!! A. Toce

if you are satisfied with good and adequate, don't bother to go; however, if you would like an extraordinary experience and wish to feel like you are a preferred guest in NYC at someone's home, give the Carlyle a try

My wife and I spent three nights at The Carlyle last week. The staff makes one feel "like family". Everyone went "the extra mile" to make our stay special. When you think about all those "famous guests" who have stayed here. We're just "regular people". I can't imagine what more they could have done . Excellent-plus

This legendary hotel is one of my favorite places to visit when in New York. Located close to my former apartment in New York the place feels like coming home. Haven't stayed here yet but go to the jazz club located in the hotel whenever in New York and love the true New York feel on the upper east side.

This hotel is much much much too dated. The water pressure is non existent, the A/C is spotty, there is ZERO entertainment (not even on demand, just live cable only with 60 basic channels). The hotel is slowly renovating, and the construction starts at 8AM on weekdays. You WILL hear it, and there's nothing the staff can do. The spa is outdated, the room service menu is spotty at best. The staff is LOVELY however. Whoever is running this hotel from a guest experience perspective needs to bring this property up to 2019 standards.

We stayed one night at the Carlyle while passing through NYC on our way to a wedding in Jersey. It also happened to be our 5 year anniversary so it was a great excuse to try this classic hotel. I can say that we will stay here whenever we can in the future! The staff was very friendly and attentive, and although we didn't have a chance to use much of the facility, our room and the basement jazz bar were fantastic. We were put in a renovated room which was beautiful - and to top it off they left kind congratulatory notes and treats for our anniversary. Would highly recommend- we didn't want to leave!

Great hotel and excellent service! My wife and I had a great time. The staff is always attentive and very courteous. Food is great. Bemelman's is always a place we enjoy visiting, live music and great drinks.

I've been staying at the Carlyle Hotel on and off for the past fifty years. It is very difficult to maintain excellence for a few years, much less decades. The Carlyle does it. It is immaculate, grand and stylish. The employees have not lost the joy of service. They have that all-to-rare quality of actually anticipating your needs. The concierges are among the most resourceful in the world. The food is exquisite. The furnishings are the epitome of elegance. As Frank Sinatra once crooned "Start spreading the news.........."

Came to celebrate our anniversary in NY and the Carlyle did not fail to exceed our expectations. From our arrival to our departure, the team really aimed to please us. They heard we were celebrating and had a wonderful surprise waiting for us in the room. Even when we had a noise issue in our room, they quickly fixed the issue.Everyone we dealt with was friendly, attentive and made you feel special. Looking forward to our return! Thanks to all!

The Carlyle is an exceptional NYC experience not to be missed. Some of their rooms could use some updates but overall, it's a wonderful hotel with an exceptional staff and amenities. When staying here, take advantage of their food and drink experiences, including their main dining room, tea lounge and Bemelman's Bar, which is my favorite in NYC! The hotel is also absolutely magical during the holidays.
user_name:
catharinenyc
New York City, New York

review_body: My stay at the Carlyle was magical. I had a negative experience on 2016 but decided to give the iconic property one more chance. I am so glad I did. The accommodations and staff were perfection. The level of customer service was incredible. It felt as though the staff had an extra little surprise each day of our stay. The room view in the Deluxe Tower Room was breathtaking.The location of the Carlyle Hotel cannot be beat, Central Park is literally two blocks away. The same can be said for subway access, restaurants and shopping.I hope to return to New Your City for another visit in the Fall. When I do, I will stay at The Carlyle.

Loved staying in this hotel for a special event. the staff was incredibly accommodating, especially Arianna Johnson. The new rooms are beautiful and retain the special charm of the Carlyle. Would come back in a heartbeat!

If you find fault at the Carlyle surely you are trying to. What an exceptional, beautiful, extraordinary experience. Truly like a step back in time. This is old New York at its finest. Service cannot be matched anywhere! A special thanks to Stephanie for our over the top suite and Charles for the most delightful dinner at the Carlyle Restaurant. And to many others over the Memorial day weekend who with their kindness and commitment to service made our time so very memorable. Our first visit yes, but most certainly not our last. Thank you. We are still basking in the glow!

Rarely does a hotel hit such consistently high marks in every category over an extended period of time. Location, service, cleanliness, sophistication, cuisine, cocktails, entertainment, and overall attention to detail come standard at The Carlyle. A true model in hospitality for all other hotels to follow.
user_name:
Mark H
Short Hills, New Jersey

review_body: The Carlyle is under some pretty major unit renovations. At the time of our stay, maybe half or more units were being renovated which caused some very minor issues. Be sure to discuss this with the hotel to avoid noise and maybe a very old unit.

The Carlyle. All I can say is Geoege Clooney has good taste!I took my husband to NYC for a surprise birthday gift. We stayed at the wonderful Carlyle for the night. The rooms were gorgeous and luxurious, but what made our stay so tremendous was the staff!What lovely people work there. Genuinely warm, friendly, helpful, and interested in making our visit happy and memorable. We will always remember our stay there.

If you are looking for a truly remarkable NYC experience The Carlyle can't be beat! The charm and ambience is amazing and the staff are so kind and most have worked there over 20 years. They can not do enough for you to make your stay a one of a kind experience. We had complimentary cheesecakes for our birthday celebration! We were upgraded and loved our accomodations --beautiful bathrooms, amenities (the soap is the best in the world!) , furnishings are old school new York, views are spectacular, location convenient to central park and museums not to mention exquisite shopping. They are renovating the hotel and are intent on keeping the old world charm that the hotel is known for--thank-you Carlyle for being such special place and oasis in the best city of the world ---New York!!

This hotel remains the gold standard for classic service at the highest level of style and discretion. The attention to detail by everyone on the staff is peerless. I recommend it without a moment's hesitation.

My husband and I stayed the weekend for our anniversary and were lucky enough to get one of the newly renovated rooms. It was just beautiful. The hotel is so elegant and the staff move mountains to accommodate guests. Bemelmen’s Bar is lots of fun, but as hotel guests, we didn’t wish to pay the $35 cover charge, per person, for the late night entertainment, so we left early. The service was very slow in the bar and the food was just ok. Still, a fun environment and excellent for people gazing!We also ate breakfasts in the restaurant...good service and gorgeous surroundings. They are, quite obviously, working very hard to restore the hotel to it’s former self - with great success, in our humble opinion. I look forward to returning soon!
user_name:
whitneyl819
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Excellent all around. Restaurant is serene with great food and service. Entertainment in the bar and Cafe are tops, although pricy in the Cafe. I have not had a bad room, but some better than others. The "interior" rooms, while lacking views are quiet.
user_name:
David P
Hilton Head Island, SC

review_body: Highly recommend the Carlyle. Great suite, wonderful and attentive service. Steeped in history & and thoroughly authentic. An art deco gem. It was a father / daughter trip with my 12 year old (who loved it) so we couldn’t make make the most of the long drinks & amazing jazz. Will be returning with my wife next time so we can really experience it! Fantastic location for the park & neighbourhood restaurants. Have traditionally been devoted Waldorf fans but will be coming back here! Only tiny caveat is that ‘included breakfast’ isn’t quite that. Discovered on arrival that it’s only a continental included & you have to offset its value against anything else. Too complicated & too grubby for such a great hotel. It’s too nice an experience to have to be calculating & offsetting croissants for bacon!

Everything excellent. Neighbor was classical pianist who serenaded each morning. Bar, restaurant, lounge, tea room all fantastic. All staff wonderful. Only problem was heat in room did not work with outside temperatures in the low forties. Space heater was promptly brought to room.

I was being treated by a family member to a restaurant of my choice—the Carlyle because I wanted to experience old world charm with excellent food and a long-time treasured reputation.Well, forget those undeserved accolades!We entered a cocktail longe area with country style wallpaper more in keeping with a PA Dutch diner type restaurant and there was no one there to greet us so we seated ourselves when finally a waiter appeared crossing the floor and I asked him if we should order coctails after someone seated us for dinner since we were prompt for our 7 PM reservation. He was indifferent if we ordered coctails in the lounge or waited to be seated in the main dining room which appeared dingy (as though they sold off the elegant furnishings that they used to display in pictures. I ordered a vodka martini which was so watered down that I had to ask them to replace it with a glass of white wine. The waiter said he’d have to first get the bartender’s permission first and so he did.after entering the main dining room, We both ordered the lobster bisque soup which was served with about a teaspoon of diced lobster in the center of a small bowl and then elegantly served with a circularly poured red liquod that tasted like Campbell’s tomato soup flavored with maybe the shells of lobster. We put it aside after a few spoonfuls and I received the “roasted” beet salad that seemed light on the “roasted” beets and cheese but the tiny bits of Hazle nuts were the best feature of the small dish. That was enough of the dinner that we wanted. The waiter was curious enough to ask if we didn’t like the soup and we told him that we didn’t like the soup at all and it was left at that. Excluding the price of the drinks, our bill amounted to $ 130. For soup and salad. When we left, we headed to our neighborhood for take out pizza because we were both very hungry and shocked by the Carlyle exlierence!!!

There is but one place you can find the real New York still. That is the Carlyle.As soon as I pulled up the doormen smiled opened the door and truly welcomed me to the hotel. They all looked sharp and crisp in their uniforms. I was speaking with the Front Desk person she gleamed happily saying they just got new uniforms. I asked her for change of a twenty and the concierge jumped in with it with a blink of an Eye. He handed it to me with two hands such classy place. Eddie was in the elevator and he smiled. Welcomed me back every time I saw him. Tony Danza was playing at the Cafe Carlyle and the Bemelmans Bar buzzed brilliantly. Why stay anywhere else? This is an epicurean delight of the senses. This can be replicated no where else. The people make the difference at the Carlyle. I guess that’s what happens when you work at an Iconic hotel. I hear their just finishing a renovation I can wait to come back be at the most New York Hotel while being in the lap of luxury.Housekeeping immaculate. Room Service Lakshar? Was a true ambassador and loved his job. Everyone was engaged and the people make the difference here. I will choosing the Carlyle from now on only when in New York!

One of the best places in NYC to stay. Friendly employees, the daytime bartenders,especially Shariff, the elevator operators, all of the doormen, Emilio and Nick, the front desk personell, the restaurant staff, the maids and the engineers. Great atmosphere in the world famous Bemelman's bar. Clean rooms, excellant service. Prince William and Lady Kate stayed here. It's a treat.
user_name:
gymtandrink
Point Pleasant Beach, New Jersey

review_body: Hotel room was disappointing. Room was shabby and worn out. Bathroom had corrosion and rust and peeling paint. Restaurant head staff were very stiff and slow to acknowledge presence. Door men and elevator attendants were friendly and very helpful.

Just checked into The Carlyle by Rosewood. A very warm check in. Shown to the room by a staff who has been with the hotel for 21 years. He emphasized that they still use keys. Handwritten welcome note. Room is so, so. Waiting to check out the Tony Chi and Champalimaud spaces.

A beautiful step-back-in-time elegance and ambience, visited to see the phenomenal John Lloyd Young in residence singing his heart out at the cafe Carlyle for two weeks. Tony and Grammy Award winning for Jersey Boys - The singing and the band's music was a sheer delight. The Hotel is the perfect venue and host.

An absolutely wonderful weekend. My fiancé and I took my mother for her first visit to NYC, and this was the perfect hotel! Every employee seemed committed to making our time at the hotel as spectacular as possible. We will be back!
user_name:
Catherine Meade G
Richmond, United States

review_body: I guess I was awed by the history, but was disappointed in the stay. It took forever for the room to be ready and the staff was not pleasant at the front desk. We had to listen to a barking dog in a room nearby the whole stay. He was throwing himself against the door. Staff tried to dog sit him it was so bad. Somehow we were put in a handicapped room with a huge roll in shower, but couldn’t figure out how to shower without flooding the whole bathroom every time. Staff did not come when I called for a mop. Love the Kiehls toiletries and the elevator attendants! And of course Cafe Carlyle and Bemelmans are the best. But the Mark is right across the street with better service and prices.

We were celebrating my husband's birthday with a Broadway play and an overnight stay in the city. After reading awesome reviews, I chose the Carlyle. What a wise decision! From the moment we walked in, we were treated like royalty. We were able to check in early and when we entered the room we were blown away. It was a beautiful suite with floor to ceiling windows overlooking Central Park. No stone was left unturned to make our stay special. When we returned from the play, balloons, a card, and cheesecake with a candle were waiting for us, compliments of the hotel. Everyone was extremely helpful and breakfast the next day was delicious. We will certainly return to this elegant and beautifully run hotel. Thanks for wonderful memories!

The Carlyle is a classic in NY, very well situated takes just minutes to walk to the Frick Collection, The Met, and a block apart from the Met Brauer. Lot of good places around and best stores in NY. We needed to be at the hotel for medical reasons (and weather) and the room service is pristine and efficient. The well known Bemelmans Bar is the nicest place for hearing some jazz, great NY ambiance like the old times with Bobby Short.We used to stay at another well known NY hotel, but found in this one a great place to stay in NY ! We will for sure come back here.

The Carlyle is a special place to stay, to eat, to see a show in the Café Carlyle or just have a drink in Bemelmens. We have gone to the show in the Café Carlyle right before Christmas for the last 20+ years, starting with Bobby Short and continuing with Steve Tyrell. It is an intimate setting where you feel like you know everyone and the performer is singing just to you!! The dinner is great. The menu has many selections for appetizers and main courses. The service is impeccable with very personalized attention. The guest rooms are very cozy and clean. Attention is paid to every detail and you are the center of it. The Carlyle should be on everyone's "bucket list" for places to visit. Once you go there, you will definitely want to go back!

Steeped in glamorous history, the Carlyle makes an impact as soon as you walk in with its hardwood floors and the gorgeous 59’s decor. Staff are detached but attendant when you need them. An elegant, luxurious place, best suited for an evenings drink.

My husband and I absolutely love The Carlyle! While we are from NY, we enjoy planning nights out which feel like mini-getaways and this was our second time staying at the hotel where we have always been greeted and treated with impeccable service. We were graciously upgraded to the Royal Suite which is a stunning suite with so much history. The Carlyle will definitely be our go-to place where we can enjoy the last of old world European charm.

I couldn’t find a place to review Cafe Carlyle but Iwant to make sure to recognize what a fun spot this is and the awesome talent of Steve Tyrell and his band - especially his Sax player. We easily ordered tickets online and we had seats right by the stage and in front of the drummer. Go to dinner or even a show since they have a 10:45 show. Drinks are excellent. The setting is intimate. Performance great.

After many visits to NY and post parties ending up at Bemelman's Bar and one of our first dates listening to Bobby Short 16 years ago at Cafe Carlyle we decided to book a room at The Carlyle Hotel for the first time. We were in town for a friends party Saturday night and decided to rally our friends for a table at Cafe Carlyle on NYE and thought it would be fun to stay at the same hotel we were at for NYE. We were even so excited about it we watched "Always at The Carlyle" and forwarded it to our friends we were spending NYE with to get them excited. Well......the reality was - although the public spaces are elegant and chic the room #2306 that we had was the most disgusting room we have ever stayed in. Upon arrival to the 23rd floor there was an almost dead orchid with yellowing leaves. We enter our room and get settled and notice many cracks in the ceiling. There was even peeling paint or plaster that had fallen into the ceiling light fixture. I tried to adjust the lights so they were all at an even medium wattage and was told by the engineer that one light had to be manual because the dimmer switches didn't work. There were at least 10 stains in the carpeting that had been bleached out and obvious. One of the windows was a total cloudy white from some kind of water damage. There were literally water marks in the window treatment fabric from leaks. The little enclosed balcony had bubbling, discolored and peeling paint which looked like water damage over many years. The TV cable didn't work so we had to call the engineer for the 2nd time. Then......just when I wanted to have a glass of champagne and take my bath- all the water filling the tub was a dark brown- like onion soup brown. Now our 3rd call to the engineer after the brown water had been running for 20 minutes and they let us use another room down the hallway to take a bath. I forgot something and by this time I literally just wanted to give up I hated this hotel so much. Interestingly the water filling this 2nd tub in another room was a light green. This also meant we were now rushed to get ready for the NYE party downstairs that we were attending at The Cafe Carlyle. We stay at many elegant places around the country and this room reminded me of the cheap hotels and youth hostels I stayed in traveling around Europe for the summer in College- hence "The Carlyle Hostel" was the most appropriate title I could think of-

If you are looking for a special experience that over delivers on every level, look no further than the iconic Carlyle Hotel! It is truly a special place with special people that offer a special experience you won’t soon forget. Highly recommend!

The hotel lobby was beautiful. I asked the front desk about room service upon checking in and was told that the kitchen was being remodeled and there was no food or room service available. Then the next morning, much to my surprise, I go down to the lobby and see a restaurant full of people eating breakfast. When I asked the staff about it, they said "oh we serve breakfast everyday". I found this to be disappointing and confusing. On a separate occasion I called the front desk to have some ice sent to my room and I was told no, we don't have anyone here to do that until after 11am. So I went down 19 floors to the lobby and asked the front desk how to obtain ice, and was told just call us from your room and we will send it up. I found the consistent contradictions of this historically fantastic hotel more than disappointing and upsetting, especially since I was staying at the Carlyle for my wedding. Coming from Orlando, FL which happens to be very hospitality oriented, I had high expectations for the Carlyle. Unfortunately my expectations were not met, especially for the price that the Carlye commands. I can only hope that the hotel can return to the reputation it once had. As for me and my colleagues, I suspect our future New York visits will be to The Plaza Hotel.

I love the Carlyle. There is always a sense of warmth and welcome from beginning to end. The hotel is currently undergoing major renovations but I hope the superb service never changes. Best hotel in NYC.

The Carlyle is without a doubt the finest hotel you will ever stay in. Historic. Beautiful. And the experience is outstanding on every level. Be sure to enjoy a cocktail in Bemelmans Bar and catch a show
user_name:
LouisD2057
New York Mills, New York

review_body: The Carlyle is a passion for some recurrent guests. Indeed, it is pitched to frequent visitors who want a home away from home. It is luxurious; service is very attentive; and there are good restaurants and bar. But it is also a little old and not very imaginative.The bar and restaurants are high quality though their biggest draw may be that celebrities and the super wealthy feel they are not on display but almost at home. They are typically jammed in the evenings. There is often good jazz in the bar.The location is great for the Met and other Upper East Side attractions. For the price charged they should be able to offer better elevator service. I get it that a ‘manned’ lift appeals to some as a ‘personal’ touch. But having only one lift running - as has often been the case during years of renovations - is pretty tedious.

Great traditional hotel with impeccable service. One of the last buildings with elevators operated by an actual person as you could see in upscale establishment a few decades ago. Everything is in line with old charm.

The Carlyle never fails to impress. Some complain it needs an update, which it is getting l, but the staff is fantastic despite the color of the curtains. Bemelmen’s Bar is one of our favorites in the world with Paris’ Hemingway and Crillon bars. Always a classy, chic crowd. A real treat.

Staying at hotel in NYC you have certain expectations about service and amenities. When you meet a charming elevator operator, are greeted warmly at reception, find special treats in your room after a long day you know you’re at a special place.

We stay two nights at the Carlyle and enjoyed our stay. However, the room we stayed in, which was located in the tower, was a bit tired. They are updating the lower floors — hopefully they will soon be updating the upper floors. Also, service was good, but it took three requests to get a bucket of ice. Finally, the ac system was very erratic. But it is a great location for the upper east side and Central Park.

We stayed here while travelling to New York to get married. We were given a wonderful Art Deco suite that was elegant and spacious and took my breath away. The 1930s' building is beautiful and exactly what I was looking for when searching for the perfect place to stay.After getting ready and making my way through the lobby on the day of my wedding, I could not have felt more special and it was the most elegant way to start married life that I could have imagined.Bemelmans Bar, the daily breakfast and room service are all superb, and the added extras such as the elevator attendant, friendly concierge and wonderfully warm staff really transport you back to a bygone era. The location of The Carlyle was perfect for us as we got married at Rockefeller and it was a 10-minute drive. However, the hotel's proximity to the museums, park and Fifth Avenue shopping are also perfect for tourists. My only regret is that due to heavy traffic because of the parade, I left in a rush and did not get the name of the fantastic lady in Guest Services who went out of her way to make our stay so special. I would very much like to send her a thank you, if the hotel could get in touch?We intend to return on every anniversary. Thanks so much.

I wanted to stay at the Carlyle because it's such an institution, and I had been to NYC many times but never the UES so thought it would be a perfect solo stay for a bit of an old school New York experience. It was meant as both an accommodation and a history experience. It certainly delivered on the latter but I think it could use some improvement on the former. I will say that there truly is something special about stepping through the doors and into the beautiful intimate lobby, and riding up the old school elevators with the uniformed attendant, the whole place feels like a film set and almost a magic relic in the modern world. Location 4.5/5: This would not be the place to stay for a first time visitor (I would recommend Nomad/Midtown for that), but the location itself is fantastic is you are clear on what you are looking for. It's a stone's throw away from major museums, shopping on Madison (much better than the crazy busy ones on 5th Ave and in Soho), The Park and sufficiently close to a subway. It was also faster than expected to take a car downtown if you are going down Lexington (a 2min walk away). What it makes up for in maybe midtown convenience is a beautiful sense of peaceRoom 4.5/5: I had a room in the higher tower section and it was renovated. The room was bigger than expected, wonderfully laid out and proportioned. I want to call out the ample storage space (not done enough by most hotels) and the heavenly bed! The temperature control was great and quiet – which I also want to call it because it’s not always the case in older properties. I felt that the reservations team also did their best to accommodate my room requests so really really happy with the service there. The room was also very bright and light is SUCH a treat in NYC and the view was really something. I definitely encourage you to pay more if you can to ensure that you can get a brighter room (higher floor, not facing a courtyard), the building is one of the highest in the area, so once you get above a certain floor you are rewarded with some great views (particularly if you face downtown or the park), mine room was a corner facing East and North. The one thing that wasn’t perfect is that the bathroom – while beautifully renovated, is really tiny. Two people could not fit in the bathroom, this might be just my room so you can always inquire and ask for a bigger bathroom when you can. The shower pressure and the toiletries are excellent and I really commend them for doing the best with the space. Ambience/Amenities 4.5/5: The hotel has a quiet intimate luxury that exudes more a private residence than hotel (because it also is). It delivers on the home away from part, and did not feel like a large hotel. The elevator attendants were for the most part quite friendly and such a fun novel experience! While lobby is beautiful and common areas generally well maintained, I think there is definitely opportunity to for a refresh. For example, the bathrooms by the restaurant felt cheap compared to the rest of the property. Nothing glaring but I can see why they need to undergo a renovation. However, the biggest selling point here is truly the discrete, elegant and quite luxury of the ambiance. Service 4/5: Overall very great service from almost everyone with the exception of the breakfast staff which really put a huge damper on what would have otherwise been an excellent stay. I want to thank Jamie Lee at the front desk for trying her best to accommodate all my needs, including early check in. A great pre stay experience is always valued. Front desk, bellman, and the elevator attendants were all very friendly. Housekeeping/turn down was also excellent. I also had a facial at the spa which was really really fantastic and I would likely go again next time I'm in NYC even if I dont stay at the hotel. Food/Drinks 3/5: I am only giving this a 3 because Bemelmans was such an excellent experience. Even if you dont stay at The Carlyle, try to go to Bemelmans - I've recommended it to everyone and will definitely go back. The ambiance is simply phenomenal. Breakfast at the restaurant was appalling, I had booked a breakfast inclusive rate and came down for the breakfast buffet, and after I was seated and provided my room #, I went to fetch an orange juice and took a quick scan of the offerings (which were decent enough but nothing to write home about) before going back to my seat. When I actually got up again to get food about 5min later, they were already putting everything away. I thought this was just awful service because never did the maitre'd OR my server mention that they were going to be putting the food away basically immediately after I sat down for a buffet - had I known I would have either hustled to get my food or just ordered room service. A simple "FYI we will be happy to seat you but we'll be putting the food away in 5min" would have been basic service courtesy. I wasn't feeling well so I ended up just going back to my room and didn't bother bringing this up, but it felt like a complete disregard for customers especially considering that had I not had breakfast in my rate, they likely would have try to bill me $45 for it. It was a disappointing way to end what otherwise was a great stay.Overall I would still consider staying at this property again.

We had a wonderful 2 night stay in a 2 bedroom suite last week. Once you step into the lobby of the hotel you know you are in a special place. We experienced great service from everyone we encountered - many of which I understand have been at the hotel for many years and you could tell they wore their Carlyle pride in everything they did. It was made clear to us that the hotel is undergoing major renovations until early 2020 upon booking but this didn’t take away from our experience at all as they have carefully segmented out the construction so it isn’t noticeable at all. They also made the entire contents of the minibar free since the kitchen was closed and there was no in room dining. We were fortunate to stay in a room that had been renovated in the last few years so we found our furnishings and accommodation to be one of the nicest we have ever experienced. We love the location as well as you are one block from Central Park, amazing shopping at your doorstep, close proximity to the train and great bus access right at the doorstep. If you are looking to stay in the hottest hotel in the hippest neighborhood you may enjoy other hotels more but for us you can’t beat the history and glamour of the Carlyle.

Mom stayed here during her visit at NYC. Elegancy spoke for itself. Jazz lounge bar renovation ongoing but provides drinks and beverages with live music still. Suits family and business guests both. Highly recommend.

There is no other property that I have ever stayed at that compares to the Carlyle! Nothing is left to chance, every staff member cares about you and your experience, in a truly genuine manner. The accommodation are the best and the views are to die for!

Recently stayed for 1 night to celebrate a special occasion. We were upgraded from a deluxe room to a suite which was wonderfully spacious (except for the bathroom) and generous on their part. This historic hotel was on our bucket list and glad to have crossed it off. The service was fantastic and staff were all gracious hosts. It is an old hotel currently under renovation. Our suite was in need of one of those make-overs. The upholstery was falling apart and the furnishings were of another era. The bathroom was also old-school - when people didn't value space and luxury. You couldn't swing a cat in it. Single sink, toilet, and tub with wall shower head, a tight little room that seemed out of place with all the space in the suite. Would like to go back once the reno's are complete. But will ask about the bathroom size etc. before doing so.All said, it was a charming hotel with great service oriented staff. Woody Allen's band happened to be playing the night we were there. Woody needs to retire... The rest of the band was great.

My wife and I will be enjoying the Cafe Carlyle again in November. It’s always an enjoyable evening. While we aren’t staying at the hotel their concierge, Stephanie, made dinner reservations for us nearby. Superb service! We’ll be staying there in our next NYC visit. Well done!

Overall, I had a very nice stay at the Carlyle for a last minute overnight in New York. The Carlyle is a very historic hotel with a storied reputation. However, in many ways it's age shows in the rooms and certain interiors. The room was comfortable, but definitely in need of an update...finishes were old and worn and not up to the standards of other Rosewood properties. I'm sure it was great in the 1990's. Otherwise, the amenities provided were what one would expect in a 5 star hotel. Kiehl's products, plush towels robes and slippers. Since the hotel is renovating their kitchen, snacks, soft drinks, and beer were offered from the mini bar for free, which I appreciated. One thing the hotel does offer that many other New York hotels do not, is great views. My room was on the 27th floor and had a beautiful view up Madison Ave, out over Central Park and the Met Museum. The hotel lobby is very beautiful....and if every part of the hotel was as well kept as that space I think the Carlyle could be great. However, until they full update the rooms to standards that meet their prices I will be taking my business elsewhere in NYC. I think that Rosewood should look at some its neighbors for inspiration...other UES hotels have been recently renovated to great success. The Lowell Hotel was tried and outdated and then was renovated by Michael Smith and is now one of the chicest spots in town. Needless to say, the Bemelmans Bar is still fabulous.
user_name:
AFCND92
New York City, New York

review_body: I had a surprisingly disappointing stay at what I thought was supposed to be a nice hotel. We were moving apartments close by, and I booked a 3 night stay. The service was almost non-existent. We asked for a crib before check-in, then again three separate times after we checked in. It finally arrived after 11 PM! We asked for silverware so that we could eat our room service. Never brought it. We ended up eating with coffee stirrers in the room. No one offered a smile or hello, or offered to open a door when I was coming through with a stroller. The rooms are very dated. Overall, just a very disappointing stay. It seems like this hotel is just resting on a famous name.

Being stuck in NYC because of flight cancellation was stressful. But checking into The Carlyle made it all better! The beauty of the hotel put smiles on our faces. The friendly, attentive staff quickly engaged and put smiles in our hearts. What began as a burden of travel arrangements ended as a joy of luxury. Thank you to all at The Carlyle!

For my birthday, my husband treated me to an overnight at the Carlyle. This stay was nothing short of fabulous. The service was incredible. From the moment we arrived until the very last minutes of our stay, we were treated like royalty. The entire stay was perfection.

When we go to New York we always stay at the Carlyle. It is the finest hotel we have ever stayed in and we have stayed in some pretty magnificent hotels around the world. No other hotel has provided better and more consistent service, food and a great nights sleep.

Staying to recoop from a surgery in the city. Very Loud drilling work being done in room next door made it impossible to rest or even hear tv. Not at all the standards I would expect from the Carlyle. they were aware of reason for stay and should have been more accommodating, perhaps placed us in a room with no work being done close by.

A Rosewood bed of elegance! I’m a big fan of every Rosewood Hotel I’ve been to. And this one is no exception; the management has done a great job of maintaining the charm of the classic Carlyle hotel from an era gone-by on New York’s upper east side. It also helps to be next to one of the best restaurants in NY run by chef extraordinaire Daniel Boulud- you can’t go wrong staying at the Carlyle. If you are looking for a hip, loud or high energy hotel that caters to the average joe, this is not that hotel. We like to bring our golden retriever with us and make it a home away from home. And need I say, try the spa for a great facial and then hit the restaurant for afternoon tea with friends. If you want to ditch going to the rosewood for a hotel stay, then try going here for dinner and catch some live music. You might run into a celebrity or two. Note: Jackets are required for men.
user_name:
Worldtraveller0512
New York City, New York

review_body: The Carlyle is in desperate need of an upgrade. I had so many issues during my stay that it was quite shocking based on its reputation as an iconic hotel. We had no water from 10 pm - 5 am for 2 nights while they worked on repairs. My toilet flooded the bathroom, my TV needed to be rebooted and the power in my room went out one night. So disappointing. I would wait until they finish upgrades before staying there.

Stayed here in June. The hotel is very classic and has a great location. Very suited for couple (any ages), family or business. Having been to many luxury properties (tough mostly in Europe) I though this property needs a complete overhaul. Everything in the room is decades old.I talked with the staff and they confirmed that there is going to be a major renovation. By the end of the year the whole hotel should be as good as new. Looking forward to my next stay. Ps: don’t forget to enjoy the Bemelmons bar. Really good live music and great atmosphere. Psps: if you are up for it, try a suite with terrace. Stunning views !

We have stayed here several times and it NEVER DISAPPOINTS. Wonderful staff. Wonderful food. World-class! You cannot go wrong with being on 76th and Madison. And I love the quaint, cozy, very cool bar scene. When in NY stay here!

My friend and I stayed here because we had a wedding to attend and got a good deal. The hotel was charming and reminded us of a bygone era with white gloved elevator operators and art Deco decor. The room was large and had two comfortable twin beds, 3 closets and nice amenities. The staff was gracious and the coffee in the lobby was excellent. I usually stay in trendier hotels on the west side but this was an excellent experience.

Wow!!! Feels like traveling in time. So much history, character and mystique everywhere you go in the hotel. From the lobby to the restaurant and bar and then the hidden show of the evening. So impressive... Massimiliano, the Hotel Manager, is doing a great job running this operation.

A perfect stay. The location and quality of this hotel are perfect. The hotel personnel is exceptional, matched only by very few Hotels worldwide. I can only very strongly reccomend a stay at The Carlyle.

My daughter stayed on the eve of her wedding and we were all delighted with the kindness and helpfulness of the staff. Bella Han and Kay Wachter from Guest Services helped us and could not have been nicer! The room was beautiful and very comfortable. Highly recommend!!

The Carlyle is beyond wonderful in every way. The bar is so fab and cozy! The rooms are lovely. Service is impeccable! Most of all you feel welcome and they always remember you! The staff is really amazing!

The Carlyle stands out for it's old, very old school outstanding service. there are still elevator operators. staff is very friendly, the bar is popular, breakfast is first class. i find the rooms dated and needing remodeling. good locatiojn.

The Carlyle has a great location if you are needing to be in the upper east side. It's a lovely timeless hotel and the service is top notch. The policies are a bit bizzare and in the two visits I stayed here in 2018, I've had issues but I will say that the staff there take their job serious and will come to a resolution. This says a lot especially during this day and age where I'm finding most places do not do this. I appreciate greatly the Concieger here who went out of his way to get something done for us. It's a great hotel with a remarkable staff but as a luxury hotel corporate should maybe look into offering more services that other luxury hotels do.

So hard to rate such an iconic hotel:Pros:Large RoomsImpeccalbe service in restaurant and barClassic elevator operatorsCons:Inconsistent turndown serviceInconsistent room serviceHot water slow to heat in showerDeal breaker:3 spurts of rusty water while brushing teethConclusion:While it is an iconic hotel in the classy upper east side Manhattan the age of the building does have it's challenges. With so many 5 star accommodations available I will have to continue my search for my favorite hotel.

loved itlocation, excellent service, great room, Great Gatsby style, beautifully maintainedthe restaurant, bar, jazz club, everything works in perfect harmony.from the moment you arrive to the time you take the elevator ride with a white gloved operator, you are transported back to a golden time.loved the welcome back note in the room, the fresh fruit plate, the chocolates in the night table.Can't wait to return.

the common areas are still shinny and top notch, beautiful and five stars. The rooms however are VERY dated and beat up. I recently stayed in a room on the 27th floor, the nightstands, desk and side table all looked like they were bought at a yard sale and a single coat of paint was thrown on. They were banged up and paint chipped in so many places. I stayed at the Carlyle twice before but back in the 90s early 2000 and it looks like the rooms have not changed a bit, very sad to see.

We have been to the Carlyle 25 plus years ago a few times with good experience , but have not been back as we prefer the Hotels near lower border of Central Park . Our AMX travel adviser informed us there was a suite sale there, stay three night and pay for two,so we gave this a try. The location on upper east side is very good , not as bustling , with good restaurents and shops . A one bed room suite ( seaparate living room) for 1250 a night , works out about 800 a night for three night . There are two entrance , we prefer the one on 76 street ( better for them to have just one entrance ,better attention ) . The bell captain and reception process was efficient , the elevator like 25 years ago ,handled by elevator staff ( ole world ). Our suite on the 7 floor was sizable , clean , not newly renovated , , the window ( outside dirty ) view is scaffold of construction work. , we have to keep our curtain down . The next morning I contacted my AMX advisor that we are not happy with the suite , she was able to talk to Sonal Nayyar , a guest relationship manager , and change us to a two bedroom suite on the 15 floor , with a veranda and a grand piano in the living room , three baths and kitchen .( this triple upgrade requires an increase charge , but we agree is all worth it , as we can invite our grandkids to sleep over ). The decor is french , marble floor entrance , like an fully function apartment . Our grandkids actually practice for their piano recital . The Carlyle soap is a classic , smooth and smell so good. The Kiehl shampoo and conditioner fabulous too. We have room service for Sunday brunch for 7 people , very roomy and relaxing . The front desk called a few times to check on us to make sure we are happy. The concierge is tucked away from the reception , very friendly and helpful. A fabulous stay except for first night , almost perfect

I love the Carlyle...it is a very special place...feel lucky to be able call it my new york home...I am always treated my name. The concierge staff is so helpful. The special touches make this hotel so memorable and warm.

We stayed one night here at The Carlyle during our weekend trip, for the uptown experience. We were not disappointed. The concierge staff worked with us before our arrival on our dinner plans & we loved their suggested choice of Marea.Service everywhere was wonderful, it's amazing how quickly you can used to elevator operators! Bemelman's was a blast & breakfast in the restaurant was very nice.The location was perfect for us, exactly what we wanted for that part of our trip.Overall, it met all our expectations & we will definitely be back.

I am a New Yorker who decided to check into the Carlyle at nearly $700 for the night to lie back and watch TV, and order from room service. . However it took three visits from the engineer to get the TV working and ultimately I was told that the 5 channels I wanted to watch were out of order all over the hotel. I called the supervisor Lorena Olizadese to explain I had come to the hotel just to relax and watch TV and I thought an amenity from them was indicated given that the service I bought was not provided, She responded with stony silence. She was mute. It is of course a trivial bit of business dis-courtesy but it was hurtful since I have long idealized this hotel as the place that JFK and Truman used to stay, I ended up going home where the same TV server (Spectrum) delivered perfect service, Ms. Olizadese should be better trained to deal with guest complaints.
user_name:
ronaldfairbairn
New York City, New York

review_body: I chose this hotel because of its location and its reputation for elegance and sophistication. It did not disappoint. The service was top-notch and the rooms large and luxurious. If you are looking for a wonderful romantic getaway, this is the place.

We so enjoy going to Cafe Carlyle whenever ee visit New York. As ever, dinner was excellent and service was very good. My husband and I shared a foie gras terrine which was excellent and then we both chose the classic sole meneuiere for our entrees.I was really looking forward to hearing Judy Collins perform the Cafe Carlyle show and I must say that I had hoped she would play more of her own music. She played only two of her own pieces. She played a preponderance of Sondheim pieces which was interesting but not the Judy Collins show I had hoped for.Her final song was Send in the Clowns, so thank goodness she sang that as a closing piece. Judy Collins is 79 years old... God bless her that she is still singing. I just wish we were hearing her classic music of her past and our memories.

We very much enjoyed our stay at The Carlyle. Our suite was very comfortable and well-maintained by the house-keeping staff. Some of the furnishings though are rather shabby and in need of replacement as were some of the drapes. I expect better from a hotel of The Carlyle's quality and reputation. While the temperature in our suite was perfectly comfortable, the A/C control pads were at best poorly responsive and I'm doubtful that either was functioning properly

Booked a deluxe suite for two nights, reserved through an agency that is a Rosewood preferred partner, guaranteeing upgrade upon booking. Hindsight, wish they just directed me to another 5 star property that truly provides five star services and maintain the entire room portfolio as such.Checked in on 76th Street. Driver removed bags from vehicles. No doorman or bell staff was present. Driver went into the property to recruit assistance. Check in seamless and elevator staff consistently personable and engaging. "Deluxe" suite was anything but. Room was in dire need of renovation with dated furniture, inoperable and ill secured window treatments, exposed wiring in baseboards, peeling wall paint, etc. Contacted the front desk for a room change. Staff was very accommodating. However rooms offered were of the same condition. While we did change the room as one offered was significantly larger. there was nothing luxurious, riddled with the same concerns noted above but now later to be discovered with a corner of the shower filled with black mold. Daytime housekeeping staff was professional, housekeeping staff during turndown quite unimpressive. Late diners, housekeeper was anxious to just provide waters and ask" you are all set, right" with no offer to return even after informing her we had dinner reservations at 9pm.Room service food was average, arriving hot. Breakfast room service waiter was wonderful. Night room service needed some professional training, lackadaisical in nature with no semblance of professionalism.Upon check-out, porter was prompt. Met him in lobby, provided him with a gratuity and I was informed the luggage was loaded in the car to the left of exit by the doorman. Upon exit, there was once again no staff, no vehicle but there was one piece of our luggage sitting on the sidewalk with the shoppings bags hung over the extended handle.Rosewood markets themselves as a top luxury brand, known for service and well appointed interiors. This is now the second time the brand has fell far short of that goal, the first being our visit to the newly opened property in London. This client is going to stick with Four Seasons and Mandarin Oriental going forward........

I stayed at the Carlyle for three nights last weekend. I was upgraded to a suite because my room wasn't ready when I arrived. Higher floor facing east so the view was of rooftops, but the suite itself was large, comfortable, and clean. The minibar was stocked with things I liked, they kept bottles of water on each nightstand and the toiletries were Keihl's, which is what I normally use. Service was flawless. From the prompt elevator operators and bellmen to the friendly front desk staff, every request was fulfilled immediately. When I was concerned about my suitcase being overweight for my flight, they promptly brought out a scale to confirm.On this visit, I had breakfast in the restaurant, drinks at Bemelmans, and tea in the Gallery. (I've been to the Cafe Carlyle several times in the past but not on this trip, as much as I would have liked to see Lena Hall.) The restaurant and Gallery were quiet and relaxing even though there were a lot of guests. The breakfast buffet is terrific and my friend who's a tea aficionado was very pleased with the extensive selection available. I know the hotel's history and the long list of important people who have stayed here, and I can see why. You feel like you're home.

We had dinner at the wonderful Carlyle Restaurant on a previous New York visit and the doorman sent us back to where we were staying in the hotel's house limo that was available when we were leaving. You don't forget that type of attention.Therefore, when we planned a family 5 star trip back to New York, we knew we were going to book The Carlyle Hotel. We booked a 2 bedroom Deluxe Suite for 4 nights, but when we arrived at check in time, we were told that the people in our suite had a late check out and hadn't left yet. The staff took our bags up to a "temporary" suite for our use, and we were told we were being upgraded to a Premier Suite. Although it took a couple of hours to get into our actual Suite, it was worth the wait (and we went for a planned neighbourhood walk anyway during that time). The upgraded Premier Suite was very large (full kitchen, dining room, living room, 2 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms), and gorgeously recently decorated and full of antiques.
